abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton has embraced message that becoming America's first female president in 2016 would be great historic moment for nation, idea that she downplayed in her 2008 bid; Clinton has softened her image somewhat, allowing for traditionally feminine and nurturing traits, in addition to toughness needed to do job.
lead_paragraph: Hillary Rodham Clinton’s references to being a grandmother and speeches focused on women reflect a departure from her 2008 presidential campaign strategy.

byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and JONATHAN MARTIN
byline.contributor: Amy Chozick reported from Santa Clara, and Jonathan Martin from Washington.

headline.main: Clinton ’16 Would Give Gender More of a Role Than Clinton ’08 Did
headline.print_headline: Clinton ’16 Would Give Gender More of a Role Than Clinton ’08 Did

snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton’s references to being a grandmother and speeches focused on women reflect a departure from her 2008 presidential campaign strategy....
